text:
Welcome to the Exerelin mod for Starsector!

Exerelin is essentially a 4X game set in a corner of the Starsector universe. Factions within the sector will wage war, create alliances and compete to control a greater share of the sector.

Exerelin is compatible with a large number of community made faction mods, which you can add for a more varied gameplay experience.

Your actions will gain/lose you influence with the factions in the Sector. The higher your influence with a faction, the greater access to their support and technology you will have.

At the start of the game, you pick a faction to join. You are a representative of your chosen faction, and your actions in the Sector will reflect on them. 

You can move to another faction later, if you can earn their trust. You can also choose to go it alone and set up your own empire.
Have fun and please leave any feedback on the Starsector forums :)
Configure the Exerelin cluster?
notes: make sure this runs once per new game, so that Exerelin sector generation data is set up properly

script: SetTooltip exerelinNGCEnableCorvusMode "Use the vanilla + mod-added sector map instead of randomly generated systems"

SetTooltip exerelinNGCSetNumFactions "Note: pirates and independents are always present"

text: Your intelligence officer runs a few quick simulations to predict the outcome of the attack.

script:
SetTooltip exerelinInvasionProceed "You have no marines!"
SetEnabled exerelinInvasionProceed false

text:
Base attacker strength = (marine strength + fleet DP/2) * 0.7
Base defender strength = 0.2* (market size+1)^3 * (stability + 0.5) * 0.5
Each Military Base and Regional Capital adds 25% to defender strength, Headquarters adds 40%.
Attacker strength varies by up to 1/7th in either direction.

If attacker roll exceeds defender strength, the market is captured.
Marine losses depend on both strength values, plus a random factor.

Markets accumulate a reserve force over time that can be quickly deployed in response to invasions.

script:
Wait $global.exerelinInvasionWait 1 $global.exerelinInvasionRoundComplete $global.exerelinInvasionInterrupted $global.exerelinInvasionInProgress "Invading..."
BroadcastPlayerWaitAction $global.exerelinInvasionWait HOSTILE 750 $exerelinRespondingToInvasion
MakePlayerImmediatelyAttackable
TriggerResponseFleet
$player.invasionTarget = $id 1.01
CreateWarmongerEvent $faction.id
AdjustRep $faction.id COMBAT_NORMAL

text: You decide not to attack $entityName.
You decide not to continue the invasion.
INVASION OUTCOME:
You've successfully captured $entityName!
You have not yet captured $entityName.

You have not yet captured $entityName.

Your marine complement has been wiped out; you cannot continue the offensive.
This isn't a valid invasion target! Perhaps we already captured it?
Your invasion was interrupted.
You're currently invading $entityName.
The invasion is cancelled.

script:
AbortWait $global.exerelinInvasionWait
MakeOtherFleetHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAggressive true
unset $entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests
unset $player.invasionTarget
BroadcastCancelPlayerAction 1500 $exerelinRespondingToInvasion
text: The appearance of a $faction $otherShipOrFleet disrupts your invasion preparations.

script:
MakeOtherFleetHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAggressive true
unset $entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests
unset $player.invasionTarget
BroadcastCancelPlayerAction 1500 $exerelinRespondingToInvasion
text: The $faction $otherShipOrFleet catches up with you, weapons hot.
"You'll pay for trying to invade our territory!" The comm link is cut before you can begin to respond.
Which faction do you want to look up?

id: # this feels like it could be a billion times more efficient

script:
SetTooltip exerelinUseAgent "You have no agents!"
SetEnabled exerelinUseAgent false

SetTooltip exerelinUseAgent "The port is closed to you, and $faction patrols nearby prevent agent insertion."
SetEnabled exerelinUseAgent false

SetTooltip exerelinUseAgent "Security forces are at maximum alertness; infiltration is not possible."
SetEnabled exerelinUseAgent false

text: You have $numAgents agent(s) to deploy.

script: SetTooltip exerelinAgentGatherIntel "Gets the market's current stability, reserve size and security alert level."
SetTooltip exerelinAgentRaiseRelations "Influence $theFaction to like your faction more. If it fails, there is a chance they will turn more hostile instead."
SetTooltip exerelinAgentLowerRelations "Influence $theFaction to dislike one of your factions' enemies more. If your attempt is detected, both factions will be angry with you."
SetTooltip exerelinAgentDestabilizeMarket "Attempt the use of terror methods to destabilize $market. There is a chance your agent will be detected, with serious diplomatic repercussions."

text: You have no more agents to deploy.
Security is too tight for further agent insertions.

text: You have no more saboteurs to deploy.

GetPrisonerValue

text: Your $shipOrFleet approaches $entityName.
Your $shipOrFleet approaches the asteroid.

script:
SetTooltip exerelinMiningStart"You have no ships capable of mining."
SetEnabled exerelinMiningStart false

text: Contact with the other fleet suspends mining operations.
Your $shipOrFleet has completed mining on $entityName.
"Good to see you, chief. Is there anything we can do for you?"
"Fine, fine, we're sorry for defying you! Just don't kill us!"
The $personRank looks grim but defiant. "We won't back down from you, tyrant," $heOrShe says.
"You have betrayed us. Prepare to die."
"Just another day at the office."

script:
AddText "\Don't screw around with your transponder in our space, damnit! Uh. Chief.\""
$sawPlayerWithTOffCount = 0

text:
Moments later, $PersonRank $personName reappears, looking vaguely flustered and embarassed.

"Sorry, chief. Didn't recognize you with your transponder off. You can go, now."

script: AddText "The Omnifactory's main loading bay is a dark, brooding chamber gaping cavernously around stacks of replicated items - clearly, the maintaining AI lacks the cleanliness sensibility of the average human. A loading bots shuffles about with large crates in hand as nano-fabricators hum in the distance." textGrayColor

AddText "Bright, slick, overusing chrome and opal ornaments, the concourse is quite the unusual sight for a station lost in hyperspace. Wherever the eye looks, every detail spells luxury. On the sides, behind extravagant transparent promenades, the source of all this wealth is offered to the observation of all potential buyers: the menacing and yet reassuring silhouettes of ships from all origins, all pristine looking and advantageously lit. A bit further it's the weapons that are exposed in the same fashion. Holo displays and simulators are available everywhere to help clients to find the perfect tool to fit their needs." textGrayColor

text: While $theFactionLong $factionIsOrAre generally $relAdjective towards you, the Prism Freeport itself takes no sides. The port authority grants you docking clearance after only a slight delay.
$TheFactionLong $factionIsOrAre $relAdjective towards you, and the port authority refuses your request for docking clearance.
You're rather well known among $theFactionLong, and not for the right reasons, as far as they're concerned.

While $theFactionLong are generally $relAdjective towards you, that's not all that different from how they see other rival captains. The port authority, such as it is, grants you docking clearance after only a slight delay.
You've got a comm sniffer running on this relay.

"I've already told you not to mess with $faction hardware. Maybe this'll reinforce the message."

The comm link is cut before you can begin to respond.

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 1
$entity.exerelinFleetAggressAgainstPlayer = true 1
unset $entity.respondingToCommRelayInterference
unset $entity.core_fleetBusy
MakeOtherFleetHostile sniffer true
ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation
text: You cut the comm link without acknowledging $PersonRank $personName's words. As $hisOrHer $otherShipOrFleet maintains an aggressive posture, that may not have been the best means of obtaining a peaceful resolution.
However, instead of proceeding with the scan, the $faction $fleetName shuts down comms and powers up combat systems.

script:
AddText"\"I told you last time to keep your transponder on.\""
AdjustRep $faction.id TRANSPONDER_OFF
AdjustRepActivePerson TRANSPONDER_OFF
AddText "The comm link is cut before you have a chance to respond."
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 0
$entity.exerelinFleetAggressAgainstPlayer = true 1
unset $entity.transponderOffConv

$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 0
$entity.exerelinFleetAggressAgainstPlayer = true 1
unset $entity.transponderOffConv
AdjustRep $faction.id TRANSPONDER_OFF_REFUSE
AdjustRepActivePerson TRANSPONDER_OFF_REFUSE
MakeHostileWhileTOff tOff true 7
ShowDefaultVisual
EndConversation

text:
"Oh? That's something you're going to regret."

The comm link is cut before you have a chance to respond.

script:
$marketLeaveTooltip = "$TheFaction do not trade with outsiders." 0
$menuState = main 0
$tradeMode = NONE 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text: The only communication you can get from the port is: "Begone from this holy land, heathen. Thy cleansing shall yet come."

conditions:
!$doesFakeVariableExist score:999
$hasMarket
$faction.id == templars score:1000
RepIsAtBest $faction.id FAVORABLE
RepIsAtWorst $faction.id NEUTRAL
script:
$marketLeaveTooltip = "$TheFaction does not trust you enough." 0
$menuState = main 0
$tradeMode = NONE 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text: While $theFaction $factionIsOrAre $relAdjective towards you, they do not trust you enough to grant you docking access at $market. You are issued a stern order to leave the system.

script:
AddText "Posh olive-green pillows and scented candles greet you as you enter the grand lobby, a vast entry area for the myriad travellers who journey to Shanghai. A hundred-meter-tall holographic map of the station hovers overhead, illuminating the area in warm light. Ahead, a wide hallway leads to the primary trade center." textGrayColor
AddText "The hallway opens to a large, open bazaar. While the structure is clearly a large warehouse being used as a flea market, in truth it resembles a small city. Market stalls of every shape and size, trading venues, infotainment booths, concession stands, and even a brothel is littered throughout, creating a haphazard series of streets and alleys. Armed Tiandong agents patrol the makeshift roads, breaking up fights and helping the occasional lost quartermaster." textGrayColor
